newsitem.title: CZECH REPUBLIC: CZECH FINMIN TO PROPOSE CORPORATE TAX CUT-TV NOVA.
newsitem.headline: CZECH FINMIN TO PROPOSE CORPORATE TAX CUT-TV NOVA.

text.p: Czech Finance Minister Ivan Kocarnik will submit a proposal to lower income tax on companies to 35 percent from 39 percent, the private television station TV-Nova reported on Monday.

It said the finance ministry would propose that individual income tax bracket be realigned to reduce the rate for those making under 7,500 crowns per month to 15 percent from 20 percent -- with various minor changes in middle-income ranges.
The highest brackets would remain the same as in the 1997 tax year, Nova said.
Finance ministry officials were not immediately available for additional comment.
Nova said the plan could be submitted to the full cabinet as soon as Wednesday.
